revisions.rev:
{{Infobox software | name = ESET NOD32 Antivirus | logo = [[File:ESET logo.svg|100px]] | screenshot = [[File:ESET NOD32 Antivirus.png|300px]] | caption = ESET NOD32 Antivirus | collapsible = | author = | developer = [[ESET]] | released = | latest release version = 5.0.94 | latest release date = {{Start date and age|2011|10|05|df=yes}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | frequently updated = | programming language = | operating system = [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Mac OS X]], [[Linux]], [[FreeBSD]], [[DOS]], [[Novell NetWare]], [[Solaris (operating system)|Solaris]], [[Windows Mobile]] | platform = | size = | language = | status = | genre = [[Antivirus software]] | license = [[Proprietary software|Proprietary]] [[commercial software]] | website = {{URL|www.eset.com}} }} '''ESET NOD32 Antivirus''', commonly known as '''NOD32''', is an [[antivirus software|antivirus]] [[software]] package made by the [[Slovakia|Slovak]] company [[ESET]]. ESET NOD32 Antivirus is sold in two editions, Home Edition and Business Edition. The Business Edition packages add '''ESET Remote Administrator''' allowing for server deployment and management, mirroring of threat signature database updates and the ability to install on Microsoft [[Windows Server]] operating systems.
==History== ===NOD32=== NOD32 was created in the early 1990s when [[computer virus]]es were becoming increasingly prevalent.
Initially the program gained popularity with IT workers in Eastern European countries, as ESET was based in Slovakia. Though the program's abbreviation was originally pronounced as individual letters, recent worldwide use of the program has led to the more common single-word pronunciation, sounding like the English word ''nod''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wilderssecurity.com/showthread.php?t=25585 |title=NOD32 - What does it mean? - Wilders Security Forums |publisher=Wilderssecurity.com |date= |accessdate=2008-10-10}}</ref> The company reached its 6000th update to virus definitions on March 30, 2011.
The acronym NOD stands for ''Nemocnica na Okraji Disku'' ("Hospital at the [[boot sector|end of the disk]]"), a pun related to the [[Czechoslovakia|Czechoslovak]] [[medical drama]] series ''[[Hospital at the End of the City|Nemocnice na okraji mÄsta]]'' (''Hospital at the End of the City'').
===Mail Security for Microsoft Exchange Server=== On March 10, 2010 ESET released ESET Mail Security for [[Microsoft Exchange Server]], which contains both antimalware and [[antispam]] modules.<ref>[http://www.eset.eu/press-ESET-launches-ESET-Mail-Security-for-Microsoft-Exchange-Server-and-ESET-Smart-Security-4_2 ESET launches ESET Mail Security for Microsoft Exchange Server and ESET Smart Security 4.2]</ref> It supports Microsoft Exchange 5.5, 2000, 2003, 2007 and 2010.
===Mobile Security=== ESET Mobile Security is the replacement for ESET Mobile Antivirus, which provided anti-malware and antispam functionality. ESET Mobile Security contains all the features of the older product and adds new anti-theft features such as SIM locking and remote wipe as well as a security audit and a firewall. Versions for [[Windows Mobile]] and a [[Symbian OS]] version are currently available for both home and enterprise users.<ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web|url=http://www.eset.com/support/news/7756 |title=ESET Mobile Security released |publisher=Eset.com |date=2010-09-02 |accessdate=2010-11-09}}</ref><ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web|url=http://kb.eset.com/esetkb/index?page=content&id=NEWS141 |title=ESET Mobile Security Business Edition for Windows Mobile and Symbian has been released |publisher=Eset.com |date=2011-05-11 |accessdate=2011-05-17}}</ref>
===Remote Administrator=== ESET Remote Administrator is a central management console designed to allow network administrators to manage ESET software across a corporate network.
===Smart Security=== On November 5, 2007, ESET released an Internet security suite, '''ESET Smart Security''' version 3.0, to compete with other security suites by other companies such as [[McAfee]], [[Symantec]], [[AVG (software)|AVG]] and [[Kaspersky]]. ESET Smart Security incorporates anti-spam and a bidirectional firewall along with traditional anti-malware features of ESET NOD32 Antivirus.
On March 2, 2009, ESET Smart Security version 4.0 was released, adding integration of ESET SysInspector; support for [[Mozilla Thunderbird]] and [[Windows Live Mail]]; a new self-defense module, an updated firewall module, ESET SysRescue and a wizard for creating bootable CD and USB flash drives.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wilderssecurity.com/showthread.php?t=225559 |title=Full changelog |publisher=Wilderssecurity.com |date= |accessdate=2010-11-09}}</ref> .<ref>{{cite web|url=http://beta.eset.com/ess/changelog |title=Full Changelog |publisher=Beta.eset.com |date= |accessdate=2010-11-09}}</ref> There were initially compatibility problems between ESET Smart Security 4.0 and [[Windows Vista]] Service Pack 2 but these were remedied by an update.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://kb.eset.com/esetkb/index?page=content&id=SOLN2254 |title=Why does my Protection status icon turn red after installing Service Pack 2 for Microsoft Windows Vista or Windows Server 2008? (4.0) |publisher=Kb.eset.com |date=2010-08-04 |accessdate=2010-11-09}}</ref>
On August 17, 2010, ESET Smart Security version 4.2 was released with new features, enhancements and changes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wilderssecurity.com/showthread.php?t=261199 |title=ESET Smart Security 4.2 changelog |publisher=Wilderssecurity.com |date=2009-12-22 |accessdate=2010-11-09}}</ref>
===SysInspector=== ESET SysInspector is a diagnostic tool which allows in-depth analysis of various aspects of the operating system, including running processes, registry content, startup items and network connections. Anti-Stealth Technology is used to discover hidden objects (rootkits) in the Master Boot Record, boot sector, registry entries, drivers, services and processes. SysInspector Logs are standard XML files and can be submitted to IT experts for further analysis. Two logs can be compared to find a set of items not common to both logs. A log file can be saved as a service script for removing malicious objects from a computer.
===Other programs=== ESET has released free standalone removers for malware when they are widespread, such as [[Mebroot]]<ref>{{Cite web |url = http://www.eset.eu/encyclopaedia/mebroot_backdoor_sinowal_trojan_mebroot_stealth_mbr_trojan_backdoor_maosboot?lng=en |title = Win32/Mebroot |work = Virus Encyclopedia |publisher = [[ESET]] |date = 2008-01-15 |accessdate = 2011-04-27 }}</ref> and [[Conficker]].<ref>{{Cite web |url = http://www.eset.eu/encyclopaedia/win32_conficker_x_net_worm_kido_iq_downadup_c_worm_gen_c?lng=en |title = Win32/Conficker.X |work = Virus Encyclopedia |publisher = ESET |date = 2008-12-09 |accessdate = 2011-04-27 }}</ref>
In July, 2009, ESET released a program called ESET Uninstaller to help [[uninstall]] ESET NOD32 Antivirus and ESET Smart Security versions 3 and 4.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://kb.eset.com/esetkb/index?page=content&id=SOLN2289 |title=How do I manually uninstall my ESET security product? (4.0) |publisher=Kb.eset.com |date=2010-09-20 |accessdate=2010-11-09 }}</ref>
==Development== ===File Security for Microsoft Windows Server=== On June 1, 2010, the first release candidate for ESET File Security for Microsoft Windows Server v4.3 was made available to the public. This program is an updated version of ESET NOD32 Antivirus Business Edition designed for Microsoft [[Windows Server]] operating systems and contains a revised user interface, automatic exclusions for critical directories and files and unspecified optimizations for operation on servers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eset.eu/press/release-candidate-of-eset-file-security-4-3-for-microsoft-windows-server |title=ESET announces Release Candidate of ESET File Security 4.3 for Microsoft Windows Server |publisher=www.eset.eu|date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-02}}</ref>
===Mobile Security === On April 22, 2010, ESET Mobile Security for [[Windows Mobile]] and [[Symbian OS]] went into public beta.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://beta.eset.com/mobile |title=ESET Mobile Security Beta Program |publisher=Beta.eset.com |date= |accessdate=2010-11-09}}</ref> The Home Edition was released on September 2, 2010,<ref name="autogenerated1"/> and on January 20, 2011, the Business Edition went into beta.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://beta.eset.com/emsbe |title=ESET Mobile Security Business Edition Beta Program |publisher=ESET |date= |accessdate=2011-04-08}}</ref>
On April 29, 2011, ESET a beta test version for [[Android_(operating_system)|Android]] was released.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eset.com/us/beta/mobile-security-for-android |title=ESET Mobile Security for Android Beta |publisher=ESET |date= |accessdate=2011-05-05}}</ref> On August 10, 2011, the release candidate was made available.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eset.com/us/press-center/article/eset-announces-release-candidate-version-of-eset-mobile-security-for-android-smartphones/8887|title=ESET Announces Release Candidate Version of ESET Mobile Security for Android Smartphones |publisher=ESET |date=2011-08-10 |accessdate=2011-08-10}}</ref>
===NOD32 for Mac OS X and Linux Desktop=== On December 2, 2009, ESET NOD32 Antivirus 4 for [[Mac OS X]] Desktop and ESET NOD32 Antivirus 4 for [[Linux]] Desktop were released for public testing. ESET stated the release automatically detects and cleans cross-platform [[malware]], scans archives, automatically scans removable media such as USB flash drives when mounted, performs real-time scanning, provides reports and offers a [[GUI]] similar to the [[Microsoft Windows]] version.<ref>[http://www.eset.eu/press-ESET-Releases-Beta-Version-NOD32-Mac-OS-Linux ESET Releases Beta Version of ESET NOD32 Antivirus 4 for Mac OS X and Linux]</ref> The second beta test versions were released January 9, 2010, and the third on June 10, 2010.<ref>[http://beta.eset.com/# ESET Beta Portal - Changelog]</ref>
On September 13, 2010, ESET released ESET NOD32 Antivirus for Mac OS X Business Edition.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eset.com/support/news/7798 |title=ESET NOD32 Antivirus 4 Business Edition for Mac OS X has been released in English (ENU) |publisher=Eset.com |date=2010-09-13 |accessdate=2010-11-09}}</ref> and announced a release candidate for ESET Cybersecurity for Mac OS X<ref>[http://www.eset.com/press-center/article/eset-announces-eset-cybersecurity-for-mac/7797 ESET Announces ESET Cybersecurity for Mac], the home edition of the program.</ref>
On September 24, 2010, ESET released a Release Candidate for ESET Cybersecurity for Mac OS X<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eset.com/press-center/article/eset-announces-release-candidate-for-eset-cybersecurity/7835 |title=ESET Announces Release Candidate for ESET Cybersecurity |publisher=Eset.com |date= |accessdate=2010-11-09}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eset.com/support/news/7832 |title=changelog for ESET Cybersecurity for Mac OS X release candidate |publisher=Eset.com |date= |accessdate=2010-11-09}}</ref> and on January 21, 2011, ESET released a Release Candidate for ESET NOD32 Antivirus for Linux Desktop<ref>{{cite web |url=http://beta.eset.com/linux|title=ESET Beta Portal |publisher=Eset.com |date= |accessdate=2011-01-29}}</ref>
===Smart Security=== On May 5, 2011, ESET released a beta test version of ESET Smart Security 5.0. The beta version adds parental control, a cloud-based file reputation service, gamer mode, [[Host-based intrusion-prevention system|HIPS]] and improvements to its antispam, firewall and removable media control functions.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eset.com/us/press-center/article/eset-launches-beta-versions-of-eset-smart-security-5-and-eset-nod32-antivirus-5-with-enhanced-technology-and-features/8587 |title=ESET Launches BETA Versions of ESET Smart Security 5 and ESET NOD32 Antivirus 5 with Enhanced Technology and Features |publisher=ESET.COM |date=2011-05-05 |accessdate=2011-06-14}}</ref> On June 14, 2011, ESET released a release candidate for ESET Smart Security version 5.0.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eset.eu/release-candidates-of-eset-smart-security-5-and-eset-nod32-antivirus-5 |title=ESET Announces Release Candidates of ESET Smart Security 5 and ESET NOD32 Antivirus 5 |publisher=ESET.EU |date=2011-06-14 |accessdate=2011-06-14}}</ref>
==Discontinued products== ===Mobile Antivirus=== <!-- Deleted image removed: [[File:Eset Mobile.jpg|thumb|right|300px|ESET Mobile Antivirus]] --> ESET Mobile Antivirus was aimed at protecting smartphones from viruses, spyware, adware, trojans, worms, rootkits, and other unwanted software. It also provided [[Anti-spam techniques (e-mail)|antispam]] filtering for [[Short Message Service|SMS]] messages. Versions for [[Windows Mobile]] and [[Symbian OS]] were available. ESET discontinued ESET Mobile Antivirus in January 2011 and provides ESET Mobile Security as a free upgrade to licensed users of ESET Mobile Antivirus.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eset.com/press-center/article/eset-announces-new-mobile-security-solution-for-smartphone-protection/7754 |title=ESET Announces new Mobile Security Solution for Smartphone Protection |publisher=Eset.com |date=2010-09-02 |accessdate=2010-11-09}}</ref>
===NOD32 Antivirus v2.7 and older=== On 1 February 2010, ESET discontinued version 2.7 of NOD32 Antivirus and all previous version of NOD32 Antivirus. They were removed from the ESET website, including product pages and e-Store. Version 2.7 was the last version supporting DOS-based Windows operating systems (95/98/ME). Update servers for trial users are now offline, but servers for paid users are still online as Virus Signature Database updates and Customer support for version 2.7 will remain available till 1 February 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eset.com/about/press/articles/article/press-ESET-Announces-Plan-To-Discontinue-NOD32-Antivirus-2/ |title=ESET Announces Plan to Discontinue NOD32 Antivirus 2.7 |publisher=Eset.com |date=2010-01-13 |accessdate=2011-07-15}}</ref>
==Technical information== On a network, NOD32 clients can update from a central "[[Mirror (computing)|mirror server]]" on the network.
==Reception== {{As of|2011|04|27}}, NOD32 Antivirus holds [[ICSA Labs]] certifications.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.icsalabs.com/products?tid_1[]=4263&x=34&y=11 |title=ICSA Labs Certified Products Eset spol. s.r.o |work = ICSALabs.com |publisher=[[ICSA Labs]] |accessdate=2011-04-27 }}</ref> Also as of the same day, NOD32 has accumulated sixty seven VB100 awards from [[Virus Bulletin]]; it has thrice failed to receive this award.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.virusbtn.com/vb100/archive/results?vendor=VE14 |title=Virus Bulletin : Independent Malware Advice |publisher=Virusbtn.com |accessdate=2011-02-16 }}</ref>
In comparative report that Virus Bulletin published on 2 September 2008, NOD32 detected 94.4% of all malware and 94.7% of spyware. It stood above competitors like [[Norton Internet Security]] and [[ZoneAlarm]] but below [[Windows Live OneCare]] and [[Avira AntiVir]].<ref>{{Cite web |url = http://www.virusbtn.com/news/2008/09_02 |title = AV-Test release latest results |work = Virus Bulletin |publisher = Virus Bulletin Ltd |date = 2008-09-02 |accessdate = 2011-04-27 }}</ref>
On 28 April 2008, Robert Vamosi of [[CNET.com]] reviewed version 3.0 of NOD32 and gave it a score of 3.5/5.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://reviews.cnet.com/system-utilities/eset-nod32-3-0/4505-3680_7-32955418.html?tag=mncol;lst |title=ESET NOD32 3.0 Antivirus System (Windows) System utility reviews - CNET Reviews |work = [[CNET.com]] |publisher = CBS Interactive |date=2008-04-28 |accessdate=2011-04-27 |first = Robert |last = Vamosi }}</ref> On 6 March 2009, Seth Rosenblatt of [[Download.com]] reviewed the 4.0 version of NOD32 gave it a rating of 5/5.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://download.cnet.com/ESET-NOD32-Antivirus/3000-2239_4-10185608.html |title=ESET NOD32 Antivirus |work = [[Download.com]] |publisher = CBS Interactive |accessdate=2011-04-27 |first = Seth |last = Rosenblatt }}</ref>
